arts.ttl: Parachute power and what Fadz said Coventry City need to do after defeat by home town club - Andy Turner
arts.sum: The Blades took a deserved 2-0 lead into the break and despite the Sky Blues putting up an early second half fight, the home side added a third goal to put the result beyond doubt and secure the full three points to move ahead of title rivals Leeds United at the top of the Championship table. But no matter what game plan the City boss came up with, no-one could stop the Dutch-Brazilian’s quality on the night as the one-time hero of the CBS Arena orchestrated his side’s first half lead, having a major hand in both goals in the opening 45 minutes.

arts.ttl: Hamer strikes as Sheffield United go top with emphatic victory over Coventry
arts.sum: Sheffield United made light work of playoff hopefuls Coventry at Bramall Lane as a 3-1 win swept them back to the top of the Championship. Gus Hamer opened the scoring against his former club with a brilliant free-kick and after Tyrese Campbell had put the Blades 2-0 up at half-time, Rhian Brewster slammed home a game-clinching third. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard expresses serious injury 'concern' for Coventry City goalkeeper Oliver Dovin
arts.sum: Frank Lampard fears Coventry City goalkeeper Oliver Dovin may have suffered a serious knee injury after the player went down awkwardly under a challenge in his area at Bramall Lane. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Sheff Utd beat Coventry to take top spot - and put pressure back on Leeds
arts.sum: Sheffield United returned to the top of the Championship on Friday night after a superb 3-1 win over Frank Lampard's in-form Coventry.
Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Sheffield United and Coventry City.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as 4s and 5s tell story of comprehensive defeat at Bramall Lane - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Despite a more determined start from City in the second half, United increased their lead just after the hour when Brereton-Diaz got the better of Luis Binks to feed Rhian Brewster who was unmarked and in loads of space to hit a powerful finish in the box, giving Collins no chance. The Dutch-Brazilian then sent a clever reverse pass down the inside channel on the right for Femi Seriki, who rode a challenge from Ephron Mason-Clark and fed Tyrese Campbell in the box for a smart one-touch finish past the static Thomas and keeper, making it 2-0 on the half-hour.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United brush aside Coventry to reclaim top spot in Championship
arts.sum: Gus Hamer, Tyrese Campbell and Rhian Brewster struck for the hosts.

arts.ttl: 'A thing of beauty!' | Hamer scores a wonder free-kick to put Sheffield United ahead
arts.sum: Sheffield United's Gus Hamer curls a beauty into the top right corner against Coventry.
